home.hero.label: Software Consultant
home.hero.lead: After 19 engagements at DACH enterprises — from BMW and Lufthansa to Douglas and Fielmann — I've learned that the bottleneck is rarely the technology. It's the architecture decisions, the practices, and how the team works together. I fix all three.

home.stats.engagements.label: Client Engagements
home.stats.companies.label: Companies
home.expertise.heading: Expertise that drives results
home.expertise.1.title: Clean Architecture
home.expertise.1.description: Building systems that are maintainable, scalable, and a joy to work with. Code that stands the test of time through proper design principles and patterns.
home.expertise.2.title: Team Acceleration
home.expertise.2.description: Unlocking team potential through authentic agile practices, transparent communication, and identifying bottlenecks with Theory of Constraints.
home.expertise.3.title: AI Integration
home.expertise.3.description: Leveraging AI tools strategically to amplify developer productivity without compromising code quality or team autonomy.
home.expertise.4.title: TypeScript Excellence
home.expertise.4.description: Deep expertise in modern TypeScript, serverless architectures, Web Components, REST, and GraphQL for robust full-stack solutions.
home.expertise.5.title: Quality Systems
home.expertise.5.description: Implementing quality management practices that catch issues early, reduce technical debt, and maintain high standards sustainably.
home.expertise.6.title: Cloud Native
home.expertise.6.description: Building and deploying scalable cloud solutions with modern DevOps practices, Kubernetes, and infrastructure as code.
home.philosophy.heading: Philosophy
home.philosophy.p1: Most projects don't fail because of the technology. They fail because expectations weren't aligned, requirements stayed unclear, and nobody said so until it was expensive. The best technical work in the world doesn't matter if the team isn't communicating honestly.
home.philosophy.p2: My view of clean code has sharpened over two decades: it's not a checklist to enforce — it's a set of principles to understand deeply enough to break wisely. Velocity is the goal. Clean architecture is how you sustain it without accumulating a debt that eventually stops you from shipping at all.
home.philosophy.p3: I use AI to learn new things and let agents handle what I already know — freeing my attention for what actually needs judgment. The part that surprises most people: the clean code practices that went out of fashion are exactly what make AI collaboration effective. When you can read patterns across any stack and ask precise questions, you steer the agent rather than just prompt it. AI amplifies expertise. It doesn't substitute for it.
home.philosophy.quote: Clean code is not about purity. It's about understanding the rules well enough to break them for the right reasons — and building systems that stay honest under pressure, ship with confidence, and don't punish the next person.
home.cta.heading: Your team has the talent. Let's remove what's slowing them down.
home.cta.lead: Whether it's a legacy codebase, slow delivery cycles, or team dynamics that need a reset — let's talk about what's actually in the way.
me.img.alt: Profile picture of Martin Trenker, independent software consultant
me.title: Martin Trenker
me.subtitle: Independent Software Consultant
me.about.heading: About me
me.about.p1: I've been writing code professionally since 2008, across 19 engagements at companies ranging from BMW and Lufthansa to early-stage startups. I started as a fullstack developer and have spent the last decade progressively taking on architectural and leadership scope — not because it was a career plan, but because the problems that interested me kept expanding beyond the code.
me.about.p2: Today I work as an independent consultant, embedded in engineering teams at DACH enterprises. My focus is the intersection of technical architecture, team dynamics, and delivery — the three things that, in my experience, determine whether a project succeeds or stalls. I run my own Kubernetes cluster, build with AI daily, and have a particular interest in the old-school software principles that turn out to make you a more effective engineer in the AI era, not a less relevant one.
me.contact.heading: Contact
me.skills.heading: Skills
me.skills.programming.heading: Programming
me.skills.org.heading: Organizational
me.section.cleanAgile.heading: Clean and Agile
me.section.cleanAgile.p: I am privileged to have worked with many bright minds over the years and want to share my experience with my clients. With a better understanding of quality management, agile best practices, and a human-centric approach, we can build better products and create a healthier work environment for everyone.
me.section.learner.heading: Learner and Mentor
me.section.learner.p: Every project has its unique challenges. I love analyzing and understanding them from a cross-functional perspective to expand my horizon and, on the way, pass some of it to aspiring and seasoned developers alike.
me.section.automation.heading: Automation
me.section.automation.p: As an automation nerd, I can help identify and implement automation of repetitive tasks that waste time and energy teams could use for new features instead.
